pull.title: doc: cleanup release process doc
pull.body:
Collection of changes to to simplify / correct the release-process documentation.
I think we could still simplify this further.
For example, we could remove the guix building docs, and defer to `contrib/guix`.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->

See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [MarcoFalke](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28003#issuecomment-1649771219) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

We haven't done this since 22.0. It's not clear why dumping out a
version of git log into the release-notes is that useful.

verification.payload:
tree 675b2079fc9deaec2ff0d4bd6ef82f111c9c1d8b
parent d99ba3cc01360f3d251a1d55c73c501822f83c67
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1688055351 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1690288460 +0100

doc: misc changes in release-process

Nobody is pushing direct to guix.sigs, nor should they, as that
bypasses CI.
Use a newer example for the testing issue.
Don't duplicate the bitcoincore.org doc instructions.

events.message:
doc: misc changes in release-process

Nobody is pushing direct to guix.sigs, nor should they, as that
bypasses CI.
Use a newer example for the testing issue.
Don't duplicate the bitcoincore.org doc instructions.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,6 @@ Release Process
 
 ### Before every major and minor release
 
-* Update [bips.md](bips.md) to account for changes since the last release (don't forget to bump the version number on the first line).
comments.body: any reason to drop this completely?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body:
```suggestion
git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned on [$(uname --machine)]"
```

Could include the architecture, since it is possible to use non-x86 machines to do the guix build?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -202,7 +199,7 @@ popd
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/all.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} codesigned"

@@ -202,7 +199,7 @@ popd
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/all.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} codesigned"
-git push  # Assuming you can push to the guix.sigs tree
+git push
comments.body: Can just drop this line (and above)? Alternatively, it should say to open a pull request after the push. Otherwise the push seems pointless.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,6 @@ Release Process
 
 ### Before every major and minor release
 
-* Update [bips.md](bips.md) to account for changes since the last release (don't forget to bump the version number on the first line).
comments.body: It's no-longer relevant given the number no-longer exists.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,6 @@ Release Process
 
 ### Before every major and minor release
 
-* Update [bips.md](bips.md) to account for changes since the last release (don't forget to bump the version number on the first line).
comments.body: Although I guess can keep the reminder to check for missing bips. Will re-add.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: Added, but had to use `-m` for macOS users.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: My assumption was to run the `git` command on the machine that is running guix. I don't think macOS can run guix?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body:
> I don't think macOS can run Guix?

Correct, but it could be run under virtualisation on a macOS system, and `NO_SIGN` used to extract the attestations for signing on the host. `--machine` also wouldn't work for anyone signing on a BSD machine, or similar, so `-m` seems reasonable.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: But then it shouldn't be included in the git commit. If you run guix in a VM, my thinking was to include the architecture of the VM/guix, not the one of the macOS or BSD machine.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: (The goal being to debug reproducibility issues on guix amd64 vs some other arch that guix runs on)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +141,7 @@ Follow the relevant Guix README.md sections:
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
 git commit -m "Add attestations by ${SIGNER} for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: Right. I'm just going to remove this then. As it's impossible to provide generic instructions that work with all our supported signing methods.
